title: A better uncle for OWL: nominal schemas for integrating rules and ontologies.
abstract: We propose a description-logic style extension of OWL 2 with  nominal schemas  which can be used like "variable nominal classes" within axioms. This feature allows ontology languages to express arbitrary  DL-safe rules  (as expressible in SWRL or RIF) in their native syntax. We show that adding nominal schemas to OWL 2 does not increase the worst-case reasoning complexity, and we identify a novel tractable language  SROELV  3 (∩, x) that is versatile enough to capture the lightweight languages OWL EL and OWL RL.
